intro: Haplopappus tenuicaulis, commonly known as slender-stemmed pappus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive bracts. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its slender stems and small, yellowish flowers make it a distinctive species within its habitat. Haplopappus tenuicaulis is often found in open areas such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
